p: Symptoms associated with disease progression [ 4â€“6] including high fever, productive cough, and dyspnea were rare (<5% cases). Studies have reported that risk factors related to the development of acute respiratory distress syndrome or death include older age, comorbidities, neutrophilia, low lymphocyte counts, high cytokine levels, coagulation abnormalities or organ dysfunction, and low CD4 T-cell counts [ 7]. In this study, most patients were young, had a low rate of comorbidities, and showed favourable laboratory indices. Severe cases were rare (3.4%), and the risk of death was low to medium.
